Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, my children, now that I have completed this book, which is the last of the sciences of medicine, by the completion of its contents and by the exposition of it and by the clarification of it, in my view I have complicated for you to love this treatise, which is part of what I do with my hands, which is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation with my hands has been abandoned in our region and in our time is entirely deprived, except that barely the science of it remains visible; and there are no more than a few small descriptions of it in the books of the Ancients, which have changed many things to errors and hesitation among those who understand it, weakening its force and the art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is clear to me that I should revive this treatise according to the method of exposition and explanation and abbreviation; and so that it comes with the forms of cautery tools and other instruments used in the work as mentioned by adding explanation and preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a good craftsman is not found with his hands in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive, and one must be trained in the science of anatomy, which reveals knowledge of the functions of the members and their forms, as well as their connections and separations; and understanding of the bones, nerves, and muscles, their number and extension; and of the pulsating veins and stationary ones, and the places where they are found.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates said that in name there is much, but in the work little, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	This is what we have already said at the beginning of this book; for whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy cannot be excused from falling into error by which men are killed, as I have seen too many of them, for some are formed in this science and get themselves out of that lack of knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor who had to incise an abscess in the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries in the neck so that much blood flowed out, and the woman died as a result.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who claimed that he would remove a stone from a man who had been suffering from it, and the stone was large. When he came to do it, he pulled out that stone along with part of the bladder, so that on the third day the man died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had already concluded that it was impossible to remove that stone, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew for certain that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who was paid wages by a duke of our land to perform surgery, and he attended to a black castrated man who had a fracture in his skull. Because of the doctor's ignorance, he exposed the fracture over the wound with cotton and splints in a strong structure but did not leave room for drainage.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he loosened it according to his desires, and soon after he dressed the wound again. He then left it like that for several days and commanded us to remove the bandage; and thus it was that the skull and the flesh became abscessed, and he came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	Thus he calls to him, and prepares to loosen the bandages, and when calm is achieved he begins to relieve his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But when corruption was confirmed in the member, because he could not restrain it, and it did not cease to spread the corruption within the member until the patient was in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another surgeon who punctured a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated after some days, until the magnitude of its wickedness was evident to him, the lord of it.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the melancholic humor in cancer is pure, therefore it does not need to reach every part of the body entirely, but rather remains in the member which suffers from being wholly affected by it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary for you that the operation be planned in two aspects: one is an operation associated with health, and the other is work where there is risk even in the best conditions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already mentioned this in every place in this book where an operation occurs with error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to keep this in mind and avoid that, so that the pages do not find a way to speak ill of you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take up your arms with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with skill and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best path by God's grace to lead to health and praiseworthy success, and leave behind the terrible diseases that are hard to cure, and stand firm against what makes you fear, so that hesitation in your faith and reputation does not escape you: for it remains more to your glory, and even more in this world and forever in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Wound treatment in some monastic surgeries:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat illness badly, for then bad doctors are not named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And thus I have dedicated this book in three parts.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered about the head, in the forms of the instruments and in the tools of the cauteries, and of what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, about cutting and piercing, and about suction cups, and plasters, and the extraction of arrows and similar things, all chaptered and ordered in the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, about restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twists and similar conditions; a chapter ordered about the head, and in the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	About cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine and recalling the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	There begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I shall speak of the quality of the movements of that cautery and of its ingredients, and in what condition cauterization is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the speech about the quality of the movements of cauterization and its ingredients is long and verbose, subtle by science, and hidden as a secret; many wise people have spoken much about it, and they are often at odds with each other. For me, a little of their speeches suffices to avoid prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so I say that cauteries conform to all complete structures universally, whether they are made of material or without material, with the exception of two structures, which are tail-like structures without material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the dry and material-tail structure, they become dehydrated; for some say that cauterization is beneficial for this, while others say the opposite, that cauterization is not appropriate in a disease characterized by quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is hot and dry, and it is inappropriate to treat a tail-like and dry condition with something as hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says the opposite of that is wrong, because cauterization can be beneficial in all tail-like and dry diseases that occur in human bodies, for when you compare the condition of a person's body and its moisture to the nature of fire, you find that the human body is cold and moist.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say with the words of that person, that I have already discovered this through some experiences myself.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I do not mean that one should rely solely on what has already been expounded and exercised in the chapter of cauterization through previous practice, without knowing the diversity of human structures and the disposition of diseases in their seasons, and the causes of those diseases, as well as their symptoms and the time span involved.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other structures, there is no need for fear, especially in cold and humid diseases, because all doctors are now in agreement about those, and they do not disagree on the benefit of using cauterization in such cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing through cauterization with fire and its goodness lies in the fact that fire is simple, and its action affects only the member being cauterized without harming other parts of the body except for minor damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Here is the translation:
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	May the fire, by its exalted nature and goodness of substance, do nothing but cause superfluities to overflow. And it is known to us through experience and length of service in studying this art concerning the truth of causes; and for that reason I excuse myself from the length of speech. And if not that it would not be read in my book, at this place I hide from you secrets about the fire, and its quality in operation on bodies and expulsion thereof by which you expel diseases, with a philosophical demonstrative speech, which would sharpen your wits.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that those who disagree about the time when it is convenient to perform cauteries pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauteries are convenient at all times, because the harm caused by accidental circumstances of time is submerged in the benefit brought about by what is attracted through cauterization, and even more so if the cautery is for pains or necessary pain, strength and swellings, which cannot tolerate delay due to fear of malice, which is worse than a small harm entering through the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this does not concern your understanding, or, children, what is valued only by the common people and foolish doctors is that for the disease which is cured by cauteries there is no delay at all times, and they pause at that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not thus as they think, because cauteries are nothing but a replacement for medicine that alters the complexion and dries up the humidities which are the cause of pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But may it be that superfluous cauteries are above medicine due to the speed of their validity and the virtue of their operation and the greatness of their power.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that his illness may return at some time according to the condition of the patient and the location of his illness, and its nature, and what has been prepared in him by the accumulation of superfluities within him, and what he has acquired through food and similar causes; but if the illness for which cautery was administered is a subtle one involving few superfluities and humidities, such as dental cautery for pain and the like, it may not return, though this applies to minor cases.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common saying is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is said by practitioners, not because those who understand it think it to be a cure beneficial to medicine or any other cause before applying cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer methods of cure for certain illnesses, and those remedies do not suffice, and then at the end of the treatment, cautery is administered, and it proves effective.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here in what follows, I mean that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding which the common people and foolish doctors have.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the excellence of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location for cautery does not matter, which is not absolutely true, because I have already experienced and proved that it works differently on different bodies; cautery with gold can be good and better than iron as others claim. However, when you perform cautery using fire with gold, it is not clearly defined to you, because the hardness of gold requires careful adjustment regarding quantity, and it prepares to receive friction. If you apply heat over it by fire, the gold will melt due to the heat, and if you place some thin sheets in the fire, the craftsman can perform the cautery according to that condition.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And thus is made the cautery of iron, which must be applied gently and gradually in accordance with the correctness of the procedure.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have arranged this chapter on cauteries according to the chapters, and I have placed those of the head among the parts, so that I alleviate the questioning of him who seeks what he desires.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for headache due to cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery is applied to the headache caused by cold and moisture, which are the two causes of such an accidental condition. It is also used for a profuse running sore called "corissa" in the head, cheeks, and ears, excessive sleepiness, toothache, gout, and generally all illnesses that arise from coldness, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery is as follows: First, command the patient to evacuate their bowels with a laxative medicine for three or four nights, according to the strength of the patient and their age and usual habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then have him sit between two chairs and place his hands on his own feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the palm of your hand on the shaved part of the head near the bridge of the nose between the eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But when the heat of your hand has reached that place, mark it with ink, and then prepare the olive wood cautery, which is made as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And so pause there about the marked spot until it descends, in such a way that the skin may be gradually stretched, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand gently and look at the spot, and if you see any amount of bone already exposed, like the quantity of grain in a thimble, then raise your hand, and if not turn your hand to that tool, another of those, if it is chilled, until you can see the bone which I have told you about.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the spot and let that remain for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then pause over the embedded wound on the border and let that remain inside until the burn scar is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the spot with a four-component ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the plague boils burst open, it is better and more beneficial to let them drain.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the cord should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should remain until it adheres to some part of the bone.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is adhered to the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery it should reach the deepest part, until it presses strongly into the bone until the bone melts, and this is the way to cauterize slightly:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that spot emanates the vapor of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be treated for some time until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two species of cautery used universally, but only on certain individuals out of fear; and leave that, in my opinion, it is better to heal with care, when possible; for the head is delicate due to the solution of continuity as we have testified regarding other members, and especially when the patient's constitution is cold.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first species of cautery is safer and better, in my opinion; and with that, one can heal and bring about health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cauterizing the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs throughout the head and this is prolonged in the patient, and if you have used plasters, compresses, decoctions, poultices, ointments, cataplasms, and various other remedies, especially if it has already been cauterized with one cautery which I mentioned but to no avail due to any of those causes, then consider whether the patient's head is strong in its constitution; and if it is not cold and does not have much moisture, then at that time cauterize with another type of cautery below that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area above the crown of their head with cautery until the pain is relieved.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut open the pain and expose the amount of bone that we have described and cauterize that area with a cautery at the back of the head in the place called "vas" — which is the location where the vein is situated.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And take care in this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will thereby discover great pain different from the pain of all other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will describe this cautery in its place, for it is appropriate that the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a finer cautery than that with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On Cauterization of Non-Ancient Hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When severe pain occurs in the part of the head, or if there is persistent pain inside the eye, one should evacuate with medicines that purify the head, and administer the other treatment which I have described for diseases; and if this does not benefit, then cauterization should be performed in two ways: either with a sharp medicinal cautery or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But if you are performing a cautery with a burning medicine, then take a piece of cloth, soak it in the medication, and hold its extremities from both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then cut into the area of the pain on the temple with a lancet slightly so that it is done in a hidden place, where it is concealed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply pressure to it with bandages by tightening them properly, and leave it like that for three hours; then loosen the bandages and remove the cloth, and leave the wound open for two or three days, and then place a poultice over it soaked in butter until the area becomes warm.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Let the treatment be applied until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, use some of the medicines mentioned in the twelfth chapter on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But when you apply cauterization, do it in this manner: prepare the cautery fire, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a nail clamp, for its head has the shape of a nail with some curvature, and in the middle part there is a small protrusion.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then apply it to the location of the pain, and hold your hand — so that the artery below is not adhered to — and move the tool gently little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that adheres due to the stiffness of the tissue is such that it exceeds half of it, raise your hand so that the artery below is not adhered to, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak cotton in salt water and apply it to the location, and leave it for three days; and afterwards apply dry cotton around it, and treat with internal medications until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize at the end of the radial bone according to the cautery method, and be careful not to cut the artery in this proper but non-traditional procedure.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On Cauterization of an Ancient Ulcer.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an ulcer with what we have said about previous treatments and the divisions of diseases, and if it does not improve, and sometimes due to the severity of the disease what has been mentioned of the first cautery with medicine or fire is insufficient, then you should ignite the radial cautery until it becomes white-hot. Place it on the area of pain along a line that is half the length of your finger or slightly more, and after placing your hand carefully, press firmly to ensure it does not cut the artery but reaches the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuity of the jawbone, which is malformed due to mastication, and that the lizard not adhere and the nerves which move it, and that it not become spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood from the artery that is severed, because in its severing there is fear, and especially for him who does not know what he is doing and is not careful and experienced; and leave the operation to him at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And here I will come to the recall of the regimen of blood flow accidents from the artery according to the usual way, in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see from this illness that these cauteries are not sufficient and the patient's condition is tolerable, cauterize in the appropriate place of the head as we have recounted, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you proceed, administer the cauteries which we have mentioned in the chapter on the rupture of arteries with a two-edged cautery, and this is the best form of cauterization and more effective.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the Cauterization of Ear Pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear occurs due to friction and is treated with laxative causes and with the other treatment I have mentioned in the division, and if the pain does not subside, now use cauterization. This is the one called puncta, whose form is as follows:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And bring the puncta near the fire, and move it around the entire ear as a wheel turns, or in the vicinity of each part if the pain is in that part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Lengthen the cautery of the edge of the ear little by little until you have marked the place with it.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery touches these points throughout the ear, and which one of them, and then treat the places inside until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cautery of the turtle.  
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tumor which is cured without cauterization is nothing but of the kinds that come from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization for the type that results from dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that kind of tumor with incisions and capillary purgatives and gargle remedies, and if your cure is not effective, then it becomes necessary to cauterize the disease with three applications: the first at the root of the ear, and the second a little further in its temple area, and the third you should apply to the junction of both lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cauterization on the opposite side of the affected part, because softening occurs only in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is that you cauterize there with the cautery on the right side of the uppermost part of the ear, and a little above the horn of the head, and in another temple area, the length of which should be according to the length of your thumb, and then move your hand with the cautery until half the quantity of the tumor is burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a special type of knife, the form of which is described above.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, even finer is that which you see somewhat like this; and it should be a knife instead of excessive coarseness, a bit refined.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with the liquid that was previously prepared until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On cauterizing ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you treat it as we have said and do not cause fever in the patient, then cauterize that area with four cauteries: on top of all the temples; one caustic at the middle part of the head, as we have said; and one caustic on the occiput.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of the cauteries is done as mentioned above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and this is better; and proceed with its treatment as appropriate.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterizing forgetfulness caused by fainting.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient large doses and pills at the beginning to purify the mind.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the patient's head completely and place on the occiput a plaster as described in the chapter on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place it several times, for that is the method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the order of the method that I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if healing occurs well with those methods; otherwise, then perform three cauteries on the rear part of the head, which are located descending from the most superior part of the head towards the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Between each cautery, wait until the swelling of the finger subsides, and then proceed with the cautery using water as described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you decide to proceed and the pain is tolerable, then perform the cautery in its proper place; and if you want stronger treatment, then apply the cautery over both sides.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Proceed with the treatment until it is healed; and perform the olive-shaped cautery as described earlier.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cautery for parasites and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Proceed with the cleansing of the head using scissors and water as we have said; then shave the patient's head, and afterward apply the cautery in its proper place on the head, and also apply it all around the edges of the head, and at the back part of it, and three cauteries along the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary for the illness of softening the body to do so and the patient can tolerate it and the illness is severe, then apply the cautery with four cauteries along the vertebrae of the back, and finally apply one in the middle of the lower back where it meets the buttocks, and lift the skin slightly.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Proceed with the treatment until it is healed, and this should be an olive-shaped cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cautery for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	An epileptic should not be cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so you should clean the brain when it is necessary at the beginning of the operation and in the other treatment which we have mentioned in the division when the patient is large and can tolerate the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate the medicines, then administer gargle and mouthwash which clean the brain, before that for several days, with the improvement of the food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and afterwards cauterize that with a cautery in the middle part of the head according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the occiput, and on each side of the head apply cauterization.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then cauterize that with the cauteries which I have described, having paralysis and relaxation of the body over the cervical vertebrae and the thoracic vertebrae.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let it be an olive pit cautery as was described previously.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use a gentle cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On Cauterization of Melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries which we have mentioned, having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess inclining towards melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give them something to drink that cleanses their brain according to what was mentioned previously in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Cut off the diseased part of the head, and then make an incision properly around the circle, and then place that in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the diseased part is six inches wide, and it should be held from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a lotion; it is more suitable to use the grease from sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that on the fire with moderate warmth prepared according to measure, which the patient can endure when it is applied.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle of the head within the circle, and let it be rubbed in.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the diseased part once a week, and follow the regimen until it is healed; or if you prefer, cauterize that in small points according to what is necessary, but hold your hand with a cautery so ordered: this is a special kind of cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that piece soaked in grease or in chicken fat.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cautery for water descending in the urine.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it has been declared to you the beginning of water in the urine by the signs which I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient that which purifies the urine, and protect it from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have that person sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then he orders the one who is cutting the head to shave the head, and cauterize that area where cauterization should be done in the proper place on the head; and then cauterizes that area with two cauteries over two temples if it is the beginning of pus discharge from both eyes, or of one cheek if it is the beginning of pus discharge from one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut around the area where the cauteries are all the veins and arteries that approach the neck; and place the cauteries at a distance in the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And guard against blood flow when it is being cauterized; and if you see blood flowing, stop the area with some medicine, which is possible for you to use.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And here comes the knowledge of vein extraction and the ligation of those veins and caution against blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And in some cases, it is cauterized on the neck behind two bones with two cauteries produced accordingly.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old and constant due to veins and arteries that are in a visible part of the head, and it is verified that this is an excess of cold phlegm, then cauterize that area with the cautery which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of pus discharge into the eyes, and with one cautery in the middle part of the head, and with two cauteries in the neck behind two temples, and with two cauteries in the neck behind two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to add something, then cauterize that area across the entire cheek of the eye above the extremity of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On cauterizing the foulness of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat him as we have said in the division and he does not benefit from your treatment, then prepare and give the sick person hot decoctions to drink for three nights; afterwards, shave his head and cauterize the affected area with a moderate cautery made of olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that area with a rose cautery using two cauteries above the eyebrows, slightly beyond the hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the rose cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On cauterizing to soften the eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do so, cauterize that area above the eyebrows slightly with two cauteries in total, and let them extend towards the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be proportional to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand when using the cautery, but rather let a third part of the eyelid adhere.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cautery of the eyelid when the hairs turn inward and pain occurs.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyelashes turn inward and cause pain, cautery can be performed in two ways: either by actual burning or by using a combustible medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is done with fire, instruct the patient to trim their eyelashes as one would for a normal haircut, ensuring they are lengthened and even; and if pain persists due to their growth, then wrap the eyes in a bandage so that nothing interferes until the lashes regrow.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	When they have grown and are even, then instruct the patient to place their head in a comfortable position, and gently apply over the eyelid of the affected eye a mark resembling a leaf shape, with the beginning of the mark near the lashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place a cotton ball soaked in egg white or mucilage of fly wings on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then perform the cautery according to this method.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize gradually over the marked figure in small strokes until the surface of the area, which is like a myrtle leaf, is fully burned through.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of success in this procedure is that you see the eyelid of the eye becoming contracted and the lashes elevated away from the surface of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and wash the area for three days, and afterward place a cotton ball on it until the scar is remedied.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And for its treatment apply those plasters which will heal it.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If the hair returns because of some cause affecting it and the eyelid is softened, now make another attempt at cauterization over that area just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair grows on the eyelid below, now cauterize that area until it is raised to its natural position and healed so that the hair does not touch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cauterization and medicine should be such that you instruct the patient to pluck the hair until they are lengthened and healed, and then make from paper or cloth the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known soap and one ounce of any living oil, and mix these ingredients well, and apply this quickly so that it does not dry; and then spread this over the paper made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and place this on both eyes; and place under each eye cotton soaked in albumen, and have the patient's head in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medication and press it gently so that the patient feels the burning of the medicine, for this burning is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And as long as the burning sensation persists, then remove the medicine and press it with your finger; when the burning stops, then rinse the eye with water; and now check if the eyelid is raised as it should be after rinsing, whether you need to treat it with fire or incision, for this indicates that it is well done; and if not, return the medicine to the place where it was not applied before it darkens until it heals your operation and contracts the eye.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation:
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you to guard your operation with vigilant diligence so that no part of the medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid after some days becomes softened and any cause of hair growth appears in the eye, then repeat your medicine upon that place where the eyelid has become softened, and properly as you did at the beginning, and soon it will be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of the myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you should know that the eyes of people vary in size and smallness, and therefore according to this is made your adjustment.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to rectitude will not be hidden from one who studies in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On Cauterization of a Fistula That Is in the Lacrimal Sac of the Eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have said in the divisions of diseases and do not refer to your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize according to this method: instruct the patient to place his head in your lap, and hold the patient's head between your hands in such a way that it does not move or shake.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a piece of cloth soaked in egg white or in a poultice of bran over the eye of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery, which has this form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is made of copper, similar in shape to a reed or an eagle's feather, with one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, insert it into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But the one that is concave is better for the present purpose.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and let it drain and dry it out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, now cut it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then press on it with the cautery which should be well heated, and hold it there for a moment but do not bring the cautery too close to the eye, so that you do not accidentally burn your hand or cause harm, and now place the cautery on the flesh around the area and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cauterization it penetrates to the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization once or twice, as needed; and leave it like that for three days, and then press on the wound gently and around it apply a drying agent until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if after these days it has not healed, then apply a sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and proceed as appropriate according to the relevant chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula which the ancients first described: enter the location of the fistula and dilate it, and then place a thin cautery in that fissure whose form resembles the fistula: And pour into it one ounce of molten lead; and hold your hand gently but firmly, and do not move too much so that the molten lead does not reach the eye; and ensure that you press on the affected area gently, either in egg white or water, as the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, that is well; but otherwise, it is necessary to administer traction of the nose and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose according to how it will come into its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On Cauterization of the Fistula of the Anus.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Fissures often occur in the lips, and more commonly in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment is not effective, then use a small knife-shaped cautery according to this form that will be described:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let the thickness of it be according to the fineness of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Apply that hot iron carefully to those fissures until the cautery reaches the base of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ceroti until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On Cauterization of Fistula in the Mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess occurs in the uvula or on the palate or in the gums around the teeth, and then it becomes inflamed, and subsequently ruptures, and is neglected, and a fistula is formed, and when you treat this and the treatment does not succeed, then it is necessary for you to prepare a cautery according to the size of the fistula, and then place that heated cautery into the fistula, and hold your hand until the hot iron reaches the base of it, and do this once or twice; and then treat it with what we have said about treatment until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	Therefore, if the sinew is cut and it heals, that is good; but otherwise, it is necessary to discover the place and remove the corrupted bone as will be explained in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums have been softened by humidity and the teeth are dirty, then using those medicines and not conferring, place the tip of the cautery in its proper position, and immediately ignite it so that you place the tube over the tooth and quickly introduce the ignited cautery into it; keep it there for just a little while until the pain from the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and immediately repeat the cauterization several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for one hour, after which he can spit it out, because the dirty tooth is cleaned and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or there is decay or worm damage, and if you do not confer on the cure with medicine, then cauterization in such cases can be done in two ways: either by using a cow's horn or by using fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with horn is when you take a cow's horn and boil it in vinegar, then take cotton and wrap it around the tip of the horn. Immediately immerse the boiled horn in hot oil, and quickly place it on the painful tooth until it is cooled by contact.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	From there, apply some burnings until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you do, soak linen or cloth in the aforementioned broth, and place that on the aching tooth, and place hot iron over it until the heat of the iron reaches the pain around the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when using cautery with fire, you should attend to the thickness of the iron or metal, and it should be in the middle of some thickness so that the intensity of the heat does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then apply the cautery with fire in the form that will come, and place it on the tooth and move it around until the cautery is rubbed; do this several times until the pain subsides either on that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that the patient gargle with good broth due to the application of the cautery and hold it in their mouth for one hour, then spit it out; this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much as you wish according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On Cauterization of Hemorrhoids.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hemorrhoids are full of phlegm and humors and do not respond to digestion through medicine and you wish to digest them lightly, then apply the cautery in the form described below, having two open ends so that the smoke can escape; hold the cautery by one end and place it on the swelling once or twice, heated until it reaches the base of the swelling.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then pause the cauterization according to the quantity of the abscess, and afterward let it rest for three days and place on it a poultice soaked in water until what the fire has burnt is softened.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And afterward, care for that which was touched and bandage it with cloths until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery for this purpose is convenient.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On Cauterization of Throat Inflammation and Constriction of the Windpipe
