When one calls to the swelling, and it is apostemated and elongated, it is then called perpendicular; and if it is below thick and round, it is then called a bubba.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured with what we have said in the division, and your treatment does not conform to it, and also when the apostema cauterized remains subtle, then you should incise the one that is aggregated and round; and if it extends in length, and is sanguineous, of dark or black color, and is not central, then you should attempt its incision because there is fear of malady in such cases.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to the method I have described regarding its whiteness and length, make the patient sit down and press your tongue against it with an instrument that reveals its form and then place the thumb on one side, pull it downward, and incise it with one of two instruments mentioned in the double incision procedure.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you should not incise it beyond what is appropriate according to the natural term without cause, for if you incise too much, you will harm the patient.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use what we have recommended for the double incision procedure, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the patient is afraid of the incision, use an instrument in the cauterization of him without fear, and the way of the cautery on him is nothing but sharp water, and that you place the head of the patient on your thigh, and then press his tongue with the instrument which we have mentioned, and then take the water which we have said in the chapter on cauterization, and confirm it with this cause living, and place it neither thick nor thin, and with that fill the concavity of the instrument which has this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the extremity of the instrument be such that it is placed in the cavity as with a ladle's concavity, and place the instrument with the medicine on the tongue, and the patient lies on his back so that saliva or mucus from the mouth can flow due to the intrinsic medicine, so that none of this flows out from any cause onto him and thus causes harm.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then touch it with your hand on the medicine, and press that onto the uvula for half an hour until you see it become blackened and numbed by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a cloth and wrap it around the end of the reed, and dip the cloth in the medicine, and insert the reed with the cloth into a tube so that the cloth adheres to that tube, and do this many times until you achieve what you desire from the cauterization of the uvula, and then leave it as it dries and falls off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, do so, and after the cauterization wipe around the uvula with a cloth dipped in honey, and modify it with that which is around it from the medicine, and wash it with wiping water, and treat it outside with embrocation, and take care of it with bandages until it heals.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is safer than incision and less painful from fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	In some cases, the uvula is treated with something that is milder than cauterization and incision. It is cured by sublimation in this manner: take a poultice of ysope, origany, rue, Arabian saffron, chamomile, ground seeds similar to these herbs, and adjust all these causes or some of them into a flask, which should be submerged in sweet wine and boiled. The flask should be heated moderately, and in the middle of the flask place a tube made like this; it is made of silver or reed.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And insert the end into the mouth of the patient so that the vapor reaches the uvula, until the uvula is sufficiently treated.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And repeat this procedure several times until it is dry. Be careful not to perform this treatment at the beginning of the onset of abscesses, as it would be too harsh for the abscess. You should not do this; instead, you must declare the abscess before cauterizing.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if this instrument is not available to you, take a cane and attach a hollow tube at the end of it, so that the mouth of the patient is covered, as the hollow of the tube prevents the vapor from entering the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and what adheres to the gums and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Move carefully around the collarbone or spine of the patient or for some other reason.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then look at what is visible among those things, upon which your eyes focus, and then press the tongue with an instrument in front of sunlight so that it may be revealed to you what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which does not appear and is hidden in the throat, try to make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because a strong cause adhering near the throat will easily be expelled by vomiting; or have the patient swallow a piece of bread or some lettuce leaves or a dry biscuit; or give the patient a piece of dried sea sponge, and bind it tightly with honey, then let the patient swallow that, as it passes to the place where sharp spines are and is extracted, thus it will be easily expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And take an eel and bind it with honeyed thread, then place it inside and gradually extract it; or take a probe and gently insert and gradually move it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	And if it is not expelled using the methods we have mentioned, then use an instrument made of lead in this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be as thick as a small reed, and at the end of it there should be a curved part that you can easily insert into their throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let the patient lie with their head raised up, and be careful not to touch the bone of the throat, so that it does not injure the patient or cause pain to the bone or spine, or allow the physician's hand to do so.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	However, let the surgeon use honey, because of his knowledge of the place where the cause is attached and embedded inwards, and he inserts his hand with the instrument into it, all this according to the quantity which has been prepared for him until it is expelled.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter xxxix.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the Extraction of a Bloodsucker Attached to the Throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When treating a bloodsucker with what we have mentioned in the division of treatment with medicines and not compresses, consider the time of day when the patient's throat is exposed to the sun, after you have loosened their tongue with the instrument that we recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then when you see the bloodsucker, remove it gently with a small incision or with subtle gestures carefully.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to remove it then, take a concave tube and insert it into the patient's throat, and immediately place a heated iron in the concavity of the tube, and do this as many times (until the bloodsucker is dead and falls out of the throat) and keep the patient from water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a vessel full of warm water and open the patient's mouth over it, and wash the mouth with it; and do not let anything from it pass through, but pour out the water one hour after another with your hand, as soon as the bloodsucker feels the water, it will grasp onto it.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	However, if it is not expelled with what we have recommended, then smoke the patient with cymin or with asafetida using the instrument that we recommended for smoking the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	In this, so in what case.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another method of operation in suffigation with that one, which is that you take a jar in which are burning coals and the jar is covered by a cloth in the middle of which is a hole, and it is prepared on that hole the end of the instrument; and then place the suffigation above it; and have the patient put his mouth at the end of the tube, and close his mouth so that the suffigation does not escape until you know that the suffigation has reached the blood-sucker, for the blood-sucker will immediately fall.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not work, now you repeat the suffigation several times, and abstain the patient from drinking, and give dry foods like salted almonds, and do not let him drink water, and in this regimen it is necessary that he be kept.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the blood-sucker is treated when it is seen in the throat; and it resembles forceps as you might see them, but it has some curvature.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the throat, and the end of it resembles the beak of a heron, which is sharpened with a file, so that when it presses against something, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the discourse on the preparation for abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are of various kinds, in many ways, as will be recalled for each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And there are various ways of puncturing and incising them by two methods, one of which is for the specific type of abscess within itself; and by what they draw from the humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is for the locations where accidents occur in the body, for an abscess that occurs in the head is different from one that occurs in the buttocks; and an abscess that occurs in a fleshy location is different from one that occurs at a joint; and each has its own treatment through surgery.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some abscesses that should not be punctured but left until the pus has properly matured or they have reached a suitable condition.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And there are other abscesses that should be evacuated when they are crosswise and not mature according to their proper condition, such as those near joints, because when an abscess approaches a joint, its nature is prolonged into the surrounding area, and if it corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, it becomes a cause for contraction of that limb; or it may be close to a principal member, and if you delay puncturing it until it matures, it will harm the principal member; or it may be near the buttocks, so puncture it before it matures; but do not puncture it when it is raw, due to incomplete digestion, except for that which is near the buttocks, so that you do not cause a prepuce and extend it into the inner parts of the buttocks, thereby creating a fistula, or leave it until it heals improperly.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	It is important that you know the right time to puncture the abscess, and this is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you should know that it is mature when there is relief from pain and the cessation of fever, along with a decrease in hardness and pulse, and the sharpness at the head of the abscess, as well as other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you should know that the incision must be made in the place where the pus is below the abscess and coming from the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the incision should always be made along the length of the flesh or body if the abscesses are in the parts of the arms or legs, and in places like joints, tendons, nerves, arteries; and finally, in all similar locations where there is no reflection; for in those that reflect, use an incision according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy area, it is better to delay the incision until the digestion of the second stage is confirmed, as we have said; for if you make an incision before that, the course of the patient's illness will be prolonged and more severe filthiness will result, and thus the lips of the abscess will become hardened and its depth increased.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses should be incised according to the width of the flesh or body due to necessity, or according to what that member requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small incision in small abscesses, and in large abscesses a larger or wider incision, or multiple sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And in other abscesses where it is necessary for the condition to be excavated and incised, when it is done as if with bread and is completed at a time when it already exists, just as in the case of those that occur too frequently like boils and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised in a section having three corners; and of those where it is incised as if in the shape of a maple leaf, such as the abscesses of the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And there are those in which a round section and a crescent-shaped section are administered, and similar ones to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But in the case of one that is not a core as are superficial abscesses and tumors, you should puncture it with a superficial incision or simply scrape it.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has collected pus, you should puncture it but do not hesitate to extract all the pus at that time; having extracted a portion from it, on another day scrape the abscess inside, and then extract a larger portion, and continue doing this several times according to its degree until it is healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a robust man, or a pregnant woman, or an infant, or an old person in debility, for the vital spirit in such cases is easily resolved by the evacuation of the pus, and the patient may die quickly, so you operate on them carefully.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore, guard this chapter with great caution, and when you make the puncture in which you puncture these abscesses, you should clean the plaques and then consider whether the plaque of the abscess is small or a flat section; if so, you administer some of it or antiseptic cotton. If the abscess is large and the cracks from the puncture are many, then you should apply medicated plasters to each one until they heal.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the cord is divided or has been hollowed out around its circumference, then you should pack it with old cotton or thread made from linen, as when you have treated pustules or boils without moisture; and strengthen that on the third day; and then proceed to treat it according to what is needed from ointments until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If blood flows during the time of your operation, then administer water, wash and prepare cloths in which you dip a cloth, and place that over the location of the bleeding for several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the bleeding persists, then you should administer treatment and cure with powders which I have recommended in various places of this our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is in the time of winter, and the location of the abscess is near many nerves, then you should infuse powders in vinegar and cauterized oil, and place those on the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the locations are fleshy, then you should place powders mixed with water and oil or with vinegar and oil, and let all of this be washed internally for three days as we have said. Then you should open the abscess, cleanse it, and administer to its cure what suits it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of abscesses universally, but according to the method of distinction I have already said about every abscess in which manner the way of its cure is by separate chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section of abscesses that appear on the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of the head, small abscesses appear, and there are various types of nodes that contain tunics; and the types of these nodes are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they are soft, and contain moisture similar to jelly.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	Of those things which contain moisture like dust, and similar to them; and of those things which are stony and hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all things, and in the extraction of those, there is no fear, as the extraction of those does not contradict nature.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you express them with an instrument whose form approaches this, which is called an entromes, until you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is moisture, then you should divide that with a section according to its length by making a superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the section from the line of .B. to the line of .G. When the moisture has been evacuated, then you should excise that skin which contains the moisture, and do not leave any part of it behind, for if any part remains, it may cause issues later on.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse the piece in Egyptian oil if it is available, and if not, in salt water. Fill the wound with this and leave it for another day, for this will dissolve all that remains of the membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply the Egyptian oil to that piece again, thoroughly and repeatedly if necessary, until you are confident that there is no remaining part of the membrane. Then care for the wound with the oil until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if an abscess contains hard nodes, then you should incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the shape of a cross, and insert once between the two lips of the incision and scrape it thoroughly, and exert your effort in extracting the membrane that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	If it happens that you encounter opposition in surgery, now do what I have recounted first of all.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, treat the suppurated abscess by incision and cure as we have told you; and the incision of a suppurated abscess is easier because it contains little blood and less moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some abscesses in the head of certain people where there is not much moisture; the cause of this is that I once incised an abscess on an old woman's head and found it as hard as a stone, rough, white, which could not be pierced, and if someone were to strike it, they would hurt themselves.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other abscesses that occur in the head, this is not the case with this chapter; also, for abscesses that come to children's heads and behind their ears, the incision of all these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the incision of those in the lower part so that the contents of the abscess can drain into the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then treat those as is appropriate for that cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These abscesses often occur in the neck, armpits, and groin; and sometimes they also appear in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck often develop between the muscles, and every scrofula among them is within its own proper membrane, just as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	Of these kinds of scrofulas there are spots, for only some of them are stony, and of those only contain moisture, and of those are the malignant ones which do not obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Then in that one which you find to be well disposed during the examination, whose color is manifest and matches the color of the skin, and it is soft throughout, not attached to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and it is not purulent; ensure that you incise it superficially along the part above and below the body in line with .G. between the line of .B., and scrape out that one thoroughly from all sides, extending two fingers' width beyond the edge of the skin if necessary, as we have said regarding abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is safer that the vein or nerve not be incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be sharp, so as not to cut your hand during the incision or disturb the patient, and do not incise what is not necessary; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and had to stop your operation, then apply a vinegar trissas or other powders that cause bleeding from the wound, and staunch the bleeding, and leave it so that the acute phase of the abscess subsides and the swelling becomes mollified and begins to soften.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the bleeding has stopped.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation and complete it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then ask the patient at that time if there is any cause for other small scrofulas, and if so, incise those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the scrofula a large vein, cover that hour so you do not incise that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	And cover so that you bind that one firmly with a cloth bandage and loosen it when it falls by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cloth which you have already immersed in Egyptian oil, and then treat that area.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise that scrofula completely, then cover so that you bring the two lips of the wound together and sew them up immediately so there is no room for any superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is room for superfluous fluid due to the size of the scrofula, then cover so that you understand to incise its root, and evacuate it and administer sutures as has been said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for those scrofulas that contain humidity, perforate that one with a superficial puncture where the site of maturation appears to you, and pause in puncturing so as not to reach the pus at the bottom of the abscess, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer puncture, wash with appropriate liquid and substances for those, so that it corrodes what is left of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleaned, now you treat that with a healing ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of the pustule of an accidental abscess in the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	Thus did the ancients call this section in the epitome, and no one has seen such an operation in our land.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those people.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In cases where men have a tendency towards it, avoid the extraction of the epilhot, as doing so would not be beneficial because all the veins and major vessels are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	In those who have abscesses in the mouth or throat or both ears, when the illness is not in the bone, it is advisable to use the section of the epilhot to avoid loss, which is done by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want this, cut the epilhot below three circles of its own circles, or four if it is a small section along the latitude in that which lies between two circles in quantity, so that the section is in ciphac, not in cartilage, and this place is suitable for cutting because it lacks flesh and the blood vessels there are thin.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is cautious, it is advisable to first extend the throat skin by about an inch, and then make an incision into the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any reason to do so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the ciphac as we have recommended; and it is significant regarding the section of the canal by the membrane which is from that place where it is disrupted and by the division of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound be left open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Thus, when the hour arrives in which the perforation is feared, join two lips of the edge of the wound, and cut there alone except for the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that cause flesh to grow until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-Bucasis says that the essence of what we have recounted is to see that some of these abscesses have already obstructed the airway of the patient, and the patient has come close to death, and their breath is cut off, and some will incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe over the site of the wound by some respiration, and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And by this command, allow the wound to be open until the malice of the disease is consumed; and the malice lasts for three days; therefore, at that hour, command to close the wound, and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen with my own eyes is that a servant took a knife and cut in her throat, incising part of the windpipe, and I was called to treat her. I found the wound as it would be on one near death, uncovered the wound, and saw the blood that had come out of the wound a little.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Thus, I confessed that she had not cut a vein or artery, and the air was coming out of the wound, and I treated her until she was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And nothing happened to the servant except that her voice became hoarse, and after some days she returned to improvement in her disposition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Here I say that in the section of the episiotomy there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section on abscess which occurs in the groin outside, and is called hernia of the groin.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called hernia of the groin is a large abscess according to the size of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it happens in two ways, for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural case, there is no need for treatment.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental case happens in two ways, one of which is similar to fatty knots, and the other way is similar to an abscess caused by arterial obstruction, and in that case there is cause for fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not attempt to treat it with iron unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should proceed with caution and investigate it as described. If you find it similar to fatty knots and not attached to any veins, then incise it as you would for nodes and extract it using water or something that cleans the area; and if not, then thoroughly examine its nature, and subsequently treat the area with what is needed for healing until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the section on the kinds of knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are various kinds of knots, and I have already mentioned all their types in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	Here is the translation:
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Thus I say that an abscess is caused by heat and fever and very strong pains until the boiling of the excess matter ceases; and it completes putrefaction when at that time the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But this one is not heat nor fever nor pain, and it resembles that which happens in the lion's wound which is inside the thigh.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it depends on the color of the skin, and its beginning is like a pimple and it forms in the same way whether larger or smaller, and there are two types according to their nature, dry or fatty, and they contain moisture, and the colors of moisture vary, as I say in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you reach the treatment of this condition, express it and inquire about its beginning, which is called an intrusion, as its form will come in the chapter that follows this one.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the method of inquiry for abscesses and all nodes, which is that you take this intrusion and insert it into the most humid part of the area where you find the abscess, and you will rotate it little by little until you know that the intrusion has already penetrated the tissue.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And subsequently withdraw it according to the measure of the size of the abscess, and then extract the intrusion and examine what has come out in its wake.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the flowing moisture, of whatever color it may be, is found, then you shall incise it at a superficial section as I have said regarding other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture in the wake of the intrusion, then you will know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And draw on the dried surface a section having a cross shape according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	So that you have been taught, and suspend that section by threads, and scrape off the skin from all parts with ease, and keep the fleece or sack if you can over it, and extract that pus at the knot.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is ruptured during the operation, it is not possible to extract that pus, and you should then apply dressings for this, and now you will extract it in pieces until none remains by any means.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if it bursts for any reason, little or much, the knot will return according to the most likely scenario.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that it bursts in some small part, now apply the wound with some caustic powders and strengthen the wound, and place over it something suitable for treating an abscess by cauterization, and treat it with another method until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if the knot is large, now you should cut both sides of it and treat it with what promotes healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if a pulsating or non-pulsating vein is opposite it, now you should cauterize and fill the place with triply refined vitriol and leave that open for two days or three until the wound has become clean and the blood ebullition subsides; then return to incising what remains of the knot.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the forms of the instruments necessary for section and perforation.

E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they make hooks, thick ones, lions (likely referring to a specific shape or tool), as well as large needles like those used for sewing saddles, and they are made of citrus thorns, or thorns, or iron, or silver. And they are made of black feathers, which are used to probe fistulas in the curvature of which there are reflections, as their lightness allows them to be reflected in those areas.

The extremities of those with which section is made are sharp, and the other extremities are not blunt, nor placed in such a way that they might cause hesitation during the incision of nodes due to fear of cutting into a vein or nerve. Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They should be made of fine citrus thread, round with some length, and they should be delicate.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And it is necessary that these kinds of ligatures be large, medium, and small, so that with them the blood flow can be interrupted quickly when needed, and at times when there is no other medicine available.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to interrupt the blood flow in all parts of the body, and use them only in fleshy areas such as the sinews of the arms and legs, and the sinews of the shoulders, and the breasts and abdomen and similar fleshy sinews.

And sometimes these instruments are made of other small tools similar to fish scales in this form; with which the blood is interrupted when performed for phlebotomy or incision of a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes they are made round in this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of the breasts of men which are sometimes like those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some men have swollen breasts when they begin to sleep and continue swollen. And similarly the breasts of women are assembled and become what we call Roman nipples, hairy.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for those who need this, cut it in a lunar section according to this form, from the line of .B. to the line of .G., and then scrape away all roughness, and then fill the wound with flesh-growing medicine, and then sew together the two edges of the wound, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	If the breast inclines to the sides and is soft due to its size, similar to how it can be in women, then cut it into two parts with its pus removed, in two sections resembling a lunar shape, each of which should fit within the other at their ends, such that one line contains the other according to this form from the line of .B. and the line of .G. Then scrape away the edge between the two lips of the wound, remove the fat, and administer what we have said about suturing and powders necessary for healing until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of what needs to be cut due to the patient's restlessness and blood flow, then fill the wound with cloth soaked in corrosive liquid and leave it until that corrodes what remains of the fat, and then care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the Incision of Abscesses That Appear Near the Testicles.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that appear near the testicles are of the type of scrofula, hard, and they contain a skin that is sac-like.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of those few that contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be incised in a crescent shape according to this figure: from the line .G. to the line .B. And when it is completely evacuated of what is in the abscess of the wound, then fill it with boiled wool and leave it for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the wound should be dressed and treated with appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess of the glands or scrofula is present, then you should incise it as we have said in the section about scrofula equally.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	And if the inflammation has spread to the point of putrefaction, then administer cautery as we have previously described.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the Incision of Abscesses That Occur Due to Artery or Vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured and the surrounding area has become inflamed, an abscess may occur. The signs by which it can be known whether inflammation and abscess are due to an artery or a vein: for when the abscess is due to an artery, it tends to aggregate in the front part of the body; and if you press on the abscess with your fingers, you will hear a hissing sound.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And an abscess due to a vein is round and appears on the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the incision for this abscess is dangerous, especially in areas behind the armpits, in the angles, and in the neck, as it can be quite risky; therefore, its treatment should generally be avoided. For those that occur in the extremities or on the head, it should also be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	May it be done upon him who is of this due to inflation of the artery opening; cut in the dry section along its length; and near the incision with an inch or so from the artery, and release the tunics until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And near place upon him the needle and make that penetrate into the other side, and tie the artery with two double knots at two places, — which cause I showed you in the extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then press the place which is between two ligaments with a spatula so that the blood escapes entirely from it, and let the abscess be dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer treatment in which pus is generated so that the ligaments fall off; and afterwards treat that with appropriate poultices until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to a vein section, then you should have in your hand what is possible of the abscess at that site, and afterwards insert the needle below the place where you had held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and tie it off double with thread so that you can extract it from the other side, and then ligate the abscess with a strong bandage as I have told you regarding the grapevine bandage on both sides of the thread's ends.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	And if you fear that the thread might be extracted, then insert a knot with the needle below the entire abscess beyond the initial insertion of the needle, and tie four knots.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	And then dry the abscess in its middle part so that when what is inside has come out, you then incise the excess tissue, and leave what is attached.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then pause and apply powder which you have mixed with vinegar and oil, then proceed to give the treatment which is done with cauterization and bandages until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter on the abscess which occurs due to twisting of the nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an abscess can occur in arteries and veins, so too can an abscess occur in the nerves when they are struck or due to excessive hard work, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is done to alleviate this in the areas of the helper bones or the heel, or in any place where the joints are usually painful.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a severe abscess, and its color resembles that of the surrounding tissue, and it is among the worst conditions when it is constricted by inflammation, and the patient seems in a state of stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess that aggregates in the front of the body, and because of this there is no pain localized to one area, but rather it pains throughout the entire body without being confined to any particular part in front or back.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, when it is in the joints, it should not be treated with iron, for it will quickly lead to contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But for the one that is in the head or on the forehead, relieve the pain with spatha (a type of powder or remedy).
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then treat it with poultices and lance it to drain the pus.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if it is large, then suspend it with incisions, and scrape that area, and afterwards cut it open; and close the wound with stitches, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter I.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the incision of an abscess which occurs on the cheek that affects the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Therefore, some people are troubled in their abdomens and other parts of their bodies with growths which are called fungi due to their resemblance to mushrooms; the root of these is subtle while the head is large. And often the lips of these grow together, it is so for small ones as well as those that are magnificently large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one such case where there were two growths in his abdomen that resembled mushrooms, and there was no difference between those that were white and had a small root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those growths were inverted and would split open, and moisture would constantly run from them.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised those growths and found inside one weighing about eighteen unciae and the other about ten unciae.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the procedure during the incision of such growths is to consider whether the patient is humid and if the color of the growth is white and humid with a subtle root. Then you should incise it with a broad scalpel while being present yourself to cauterize it over fire, because moisture from the incision needs to be expelled; and if blood flows, cauterize that area.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient pale and fearful, be cautious about incising it with a knife. Instead, take some fresh lead solder and apply it to that growth in the manner we have described, and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Adjust the strap tightly around the lead wire; therefore, do not stop strengthening the thick lead, until it is severed and falls on its own.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the lead is of great thickness, then during its incision there is some cause for fear and dread, especially in that which is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you may sever half of it, and then cauterize the remaining part so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then treat it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to cut lead that is of dark color, with little sensation, and relatively soft, for such is often cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And this will serve as a reminder of certain important points regarding that.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter LII.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of a hernia of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	A hernia of the navel is caused by various reasons; either through fissures in the abdomen above the belly, and from it comes the membrane or bladder as in other ruptures; or due to a wound from which blood flows from a vein or artery depending on what is present there; or due to trapped air.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to a fissure in the abdomen and the protrusion of the membrane, then the color of the swelling is similar to the color of the body; it causes little pain, and subsequently appears in various situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to the protrusion of the bladder, then its condition differs greatly from what we have described, and when you press on it with your fingers, it retreats; and quickly returns afterwards. It is light in weight and becomes prominent especially after bathing and hard work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	May it be if by moisture, the hours are like a lion and are not hidden when pressed with your hand, nor are they restrained, nor are they created.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is by infection, the hours with these signs appear as an abscess turning black.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	May it be if it is by flesh that has decayed, the abscess is severe, large and hard, and is situated in proportion to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	May it be if it is due to gas, then the touch of it is like a lion.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you consider whether the prominence of the navel is due to an infection from an artery, or a vein, or gas; then you should be cautious about treating it, for there is fear and dread as I have taught you in the chapter where I have described abscesses from arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to the intestine or the membrane, then you should command the patient to lie on their back and stand extended; then press your finger around the circumference of the entire navel, and then command them to lie face up with their hands under their buttocks; then surround it with a piece of linen about an inch wide around the circumference of the navel where you have marked with your finger; and then extend half of the abscess upwards from this point by about one inch; and then tie it around the circumference with strong thread or cloth in a proper manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then open the center of the abscess over the dressing and insert your finger into that area to check for the intestine; and if you find it adhered or protected by the dressing, then carefully remove it and push the intestine towards the inner parts of the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the cloth, then take one ounce of it; and incise the excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	And if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then encircle that spot, and return to your operation; take two needles and place in those two strong threads and insert the two needles into the circuit which you have made around the abscess in a crisscross manner, which you should make penetrate; and then compress the abscess into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the area open so that the extended flesh can drain and fall off by itself; or incise it when it is thin enough to drain, and then treat it with a lotion from among those mentioned until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is of flesh or due to moisture, then you should treat the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or moisture that you find there, and then treat it with a lotion that will heal and consolidate the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter LIII.
De curacio de cranc.	On the Treatment of Cancers.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said in the division about the types of cancer and how it is approached for treatment with medicines, and that it is difficult to cure without it becoming ulcerated; we have also discussed cancer arising in certain parts and the care required for its treatment.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that in some cases cancer can be in a location where its eradication is possible, just as with cancers located in the mammary glands or in the scrotum and similar parts of the body allocated to removing all of it, especially when it starts small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.
