Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of the probe which is suitable for piercing through the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the tip of it is triangular and has a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian steel, and apparently it suits all the causes we have mentioned regarding knives, forceps, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Regarding the cutting of tips and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The tips may need to be removed either due to an intrinsic cause or an extrinsic cause; or when you have treated that corruption with the prescribed medicines and the treatment does not take effect, or sometimes the corruption spreads beyond a member without any apparent reason. At such times it is necessary for you to cut off that part where the corruption lies so that the patient may escape from death or severe illness, which would be a greater evil than the loss of that limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign that this affects someone is that the limb turns black as if burnt by fire, or the corruption approaches close to the blackness such that the putrefaction spreads within that member and throughout the body. Therefore, it is necessary for you to perform an amputation of that part.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the corruption is caused by the bite or sting of certain venomous creatures such as a scorpion, viper, or rattlesnake and similar animals.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the bite is at the tip of a finger, then you should amputate the finger and not allow the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if the corruption reaches the hand, then you should amputate at the joint of the wrist and not allow the corruption to spread further into the elbow joint.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you encounter that, then cut the arm at the joint in the collarbone.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption spreads around the collarbone area, then death is imminent for the patient; and each cause requires its own treatment in cure, which is a matter of the proper amount of efficacy.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, when corruption reaches the toe, then you must cut it off at one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it affects the entire foot, then you must amputate the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it penetrates to the toe, then you must cut off the foot at the joint of the toe.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread to the toe, then there is no remedy but dismissal, and let the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of cutting off a limb or binding it is that you tie a ligature above the part where you wish to cut, and apply another ligature over the area; extend one ligature below the part, and have another extended above by an assistant; separate the skin that lies between the two ligatures with a spatula until all the flesh is exposed; then it can be cut or bound.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to cover the area with a cloth from all sides so that it does not touch the affected site, and to ensure that the patient receives appropriate treatment for injuries and abscesses.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs while you are working, then you must immediately cauterize the area, or apply some powders to staunch the blood; and then return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Bind the injured limb with a suitable bandage, and treat it so that it may be healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you what happens to a man in his house, this kind of accident about which I advise you, which is one that often occurs due to exposure to intense heat similar to fire combustion.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first occurs inside his hand and then tends to spread throughout the entire body.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that person prepares himself for something worse than the treatment going to the limb due to the intensity of the pain and burning, and often amputates that hand at the joint, and the wound is healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Such corruption in the finger of the hand often persists for a long time.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then they came to me, and I prescribed them to eliminate that excess through the medicine I applied, along with the cleansing of their body; but the excess was not eliminated and began to spread to another finger starting from the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And they pleaded with me to amputate the hand, but I refused to do so, hoping for the elimination of that excess, and fearing that the amputation of the hand might lead to death, as the strength of the disease was very severe.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he left me, he returned to his home and later came back to me saying that he had prepared himself and amputated his entire hand, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have included this narrative only to assist in understanding the nature of this disease and to serve as an example for how it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of hemorrhoids and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy member and the space of the abscess extends inward forming a collection of pus, and it is then ruptured and perforated, and the pus is discharged from there, leaving the place empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin above it remains thin like cloth, and has not reached corruption behind, nor does it affect the bone or nerves or tendons, it is called a sinus, and is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space extends inward such that corruption affects some member, it is then called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is to incise that skin completely as it has formed, especially when it is thin like cloth, and ensure that you do not adhere to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	However, if you hope that the skin will adhere and that the corruption has not yet reached behind, and there is pus passing through the skin, then you should treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And when you consider the sinus, if it is large and the arm with which you work has a fetid odor, then treat it with an Egyptian medicine consisting of oil, vinegar, and rose water in equal parts, and mix them in a vessel until the medicine becomes thick like honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take the amount that is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; and administer it as an enema to the sinus, and plug the opening of it, and leave the medicine inside for the duration of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	From there extract that which is despised; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the pus is evacuated.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And on some occasions it is administered as an enema with water of ashes, when this medicine is not at your disposal; and take the ash of wheat, put it over the water; then filter that and administer it as an enema until you are convinced that the sinus is now closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the water of ashes, then administer it with water and honey mixed in small quantities three times, and administer it with vinegar and honey mixed, because the property of honey is to cleanse and wash, and the vinegar makes the sinus adhere, especially when the vinegar has an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this on some occasions and are convinced that the sinus is now cleared, then administer an enema with something that promotes flesh growth.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take of the herb dyafinicon and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent vinegar; or administer an enema with various medicines and other herbs that have the properties which I have already written about in the chapter on herbs.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow such that the enema tube cannot be received, then gradually enlarge it with a small instrument, and pause in this gentle treatment wrapped in Egyptian herb or basilicon until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the orifice is too wide, then you should approximate the edges of it with sutures and leave it in a condition where the enema can be introduced without additional intervention.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifices of the one through which the arm flows are raised above the parts below, then dry up that in the pus base location which is where the arm flows underneath, for when the arm is compressed at the depth of the bend the flesh will be generated there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry up the sinus beneath the pus base as you wish, then proceed by preparing the limb according to the preparation which allows the arm to flow gently as it is appropriate for you and so that nothing impedes the movement of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines to be applied over the sinus as is appropriate for what you wish to extend them over the cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of such a great quantity as to cover the entire sinus; then, with scissors, carefully cut along the right of the sinus orifice an opening slightly larger than the sinus orifice; then extend over another piece of cloth the healing ointment according to the size of the opening, and place it above the large cloth at some distance from the sinus orifice so that the movement of the arm is not hindered by the large cloth but only after a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the sinus orifice, which you should change at all times so that it dries what is inside the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know whether what flows from the arm is much or little, or is digested, or is undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And with this, you should consider the location of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and whether it is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that is deposited on the orifice of the sinus has adhered or is about to adhere, then you loosen it on the third day, and when you loosen the poultice, then change the cloth and renew the application.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if in the sinus there is a space for a subtle pus to form, then do not despair of its adherence, because its healing will soon follow, because some people take longer to generate flesh in their poultices, and among them are those who experience the opposite.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if for many days a thick and undigested substance remains in the sinus, then you know that the sinus will not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and this causes it to be prolonged, then adjust the drying effect of the medicines. If the medicines are moist in their composition and in their power, dry them thoroughly like a definitive application when there is an excess of honey added to them.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the best way to treat it is to take a definitive application and dissolve it in rose oil, and place it over what you previously used with its substance still present, and confirm how that works for you and use it accordingly.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems in that action, when there is no thick substance, take a definitive application and honey which has been cooked until it is thickened, and use it; or take myrrh, aloes, and frankincense, mix them all together, powder them over the honey while it is on the fire, then apply this mixture to a cloth and strengthen it over the sinus; also line with that honey you have cooked until it has thickened, and powder over a cloth and apply it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And in some cases, it is administered with the aristolochia longa and roots of lily (and that is the celestial lily) and flour of wheat and centaury, and use those simples or mix them, crush them and sieve them and powder over the honey which is recommended; and use this.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and is not healed by this treatment, then you will know that the corruption is in its root, and it has already infected the bones or other hard members or ligaments; now treat it with fistula treatment as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of paronychia and cracked nails and the cutting of an added finger joint and sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Paronychia is an abscess that arises from the nail of the toe or finger of the hand or foot, and it can also occur in other fingers. When it prolongs and its treatment is delayed, it becomes an abscess of a cauterized abscess or it corrupts, and exudes pus internally which corrodes the root of the nail, and quickly corrupts the entire nail, and often spreads to the bone inside causing a foul odor, and the extremity of the finger or toe becomes darkened.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have done what we have said in the division and do not see improvement in your treatment, then it is necessary that you incise with a knife all the excess that is swollen from the nail and immediately cauterize the wound, as immediate cauterization is helpful in such cases.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the addictions of the nail begin to push back into the flesh from the sides, causing pain and discomfort, then you should apply a fine paste below the angle of the nail that causes pain on the flesh, and push it up and incise that flesh with ease, and place over what remains of the flesh corrosive medicines until it is all removed; and then treat that with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If corruption has already begun in the bone, then you must incise the bone and extract it, for it is never healed when the corrupted bone remains.

And if the corrosion and corruption spread to the finger, then you must incise it at one of its joints as is prescribed in its treatment, and subsequently care for it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if there is a bruise or inflammation under the nail, and there is severe pain in that area, then at the beginning you should bleed the patient, and subsequently dry the nail with a sharp spatum in a transverse cut from top to bottom, but be careful that the cut does not penetrate into the flesh below the nail, for you would cause the patient great pain, and it would lead to the formation of excess tissue in the area; and thereafter treat that place with something that relieves pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But the finger that is swollen, which occurs in many people, is mostly fleshy, and there is little bone in it, or it is little in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or the swelling is in some of the joints of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born in some of the joints of the finger is not so harmful, and that which is born at the joints is very harmful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are fleshy swellings, the incision is slight, and you should cut it behind its base with a broad spatum.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But of that which is born at the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; therefore, be careful not to amputate it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	In that which is described about nuts, you should incise at the beginning the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then use one of those saws suitable for this, and then treat that within so that it may be healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	In the case of consolidation that occurs between certain guarded movements or due to the birth of a person who is born with it, or due to the healing of an illness or by burning from fire, then you should treat that consolidation until the said condition returns to its natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove. E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if consolidation occurs in certain areas on the palm, then you should treat that consolidation according to how it is prepared and suitable for the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding incisions for veins, these are varicose.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins that are varicose, and veins wrapped thickly full of melancholic humors, which flow through the limbs of the body, and their primary occurrence is in the legs, particularly in the legs of travelers, workers, and those who carry loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer purgation of the body with black bile several times for strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of them due to iron is according to two methods: one is that it should be incised and the black blood drawn out, and the other method is that the vein should be raised and completely extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The section on this is as follows: Begin by filling a bag with warm water and place it so that the thick blood is dissolved, which is sediment in the bag. Then press the patient's body at the part most filled with pus below the bone using a cloth bandage, and then make an incision in one place or two, or three near the area, and then lift the black blood on the lower side of the bag upward into it, and above downward until the amount of blood is released that you want and as much as suffices, and which the patient's strength can tolerate.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind it with bandages and instruct him to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are full and inform the patient about this.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation of it is as follows: If you see that the patient's body has hair, then shave the area where the bag will be placed. Then place the patient in a bath or fill a bag with warm water so that the area reddens and the veins become prominent; or have the patient exercise vigorously if a bath is not available, until the limb becomes heated.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then dry the area along the vein by making an incision either above near the bone or below near the foot.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror. E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And thus when you examine it, from the area take what appears to be white and cord-like.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And so you place the patient lying down with their head raised and propped up by pillows.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section near that one for three reasons, and then displace the wound above the vein that appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then raise that and incise it at the rear section behind the heel, and then extract that and raise it so that it exits through the second section, and then extract that from the section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract that from the section that is highest or farthest from all the sections, until everything has exited; then at that point incise it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not obey to extract and raise it, then insert a strong double-threaded needle and tie it and extract it, or insert it below the skin and rotate your hand in all directions until it is expelled.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut it; for if it is broken, it becomes difficult to raise that piece and it will cause harm to the patient due to this injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat. And if the vessel is contracted with tortuosities in its covering at those parts, and it is not straight as we have said, then you should cut along each part of the tortuosity and the places where it is covered, and then suspend it with needles until you raise it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful in your sectioning that you do not cut the vein and that you do not compress it, for it will be difficult for you to raise it; and use your discretion in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incident by which the operation is performed:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of applying ointment:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It should not be as sharp as a knife nor have a pointed end so that it does not compress the vein; and it should be of thick flexibility, like a lion's tail, for if it were slender, it would cut the vein due to its slenderness; however, it should not be excessively thick as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein in the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the fields in hot lands such as Al-Ategi in the land of Arabia and in the hot and dry lands of India where there is little vegetation and no grass or crops.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And similarly, it is generated in other parts of the body apart from the fields.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its formation is through putrefaction that occurs below the skin, just as worms and vermin come from within the body, serpents and other creatures generating between the skin and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the occurrence of this event is that inflammation appears strongly in the field; and near the area, blisters form; and soon the vein begins to appear from the location of those blisters, resembling a plant sprout.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the extremity of it becomes apparent, you should then wrap around it a piece of lead weighing one drachma within two drachmas, and fix that area and leave the lead suspended from the field.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And so many times when you need something from outside for some reason, wrap it in lead and note that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is elongated, then cut a piece of it and wrap the remainder; and do not cut that end until it has come out, for if you cut that one it is contracted and goes into the flesh and causes abscesses and putrefaction in the place and a bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	It is necessary that it be treated gently and extracted little by little until it is completely removed from the rear end and there remains nothing of it in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And this vein extends in some people to a length of five palms and I have been told that it has reached up to twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut during the time of its medication, then insert the reed into the tract and perforate that one along the body until everything inside the matter is evacuated, and treat putrefaction in the area with some medicines for a few days; afterwards, cure it according to the treatment of abscesses.
