E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	And tie the two rods in three places at both ends and at the middle point, for with this structure the arch is prevented from leaning to the right or left, and it stands in good position.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And a piece of wood has already been administered according to the length of the arch; and place the arch so that it maintains its mobility.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And especially do this in the case of a fracture, and when it is properly a condition requiring such treatment.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And every day consider the arch and study it carefully based on previous studies, and you must guard it from abscesses and inflammation or other similar causes; and when any such cause arises, then act accordingly until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the heel and of the bones of the foot and of the aforementioned.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	A complete fracture does not often occur in the heel; but fractures can happen occasionally in the bones of the foot; and among those of the foot, few suffer fractures, and they rarely experience anything more than strain due to their disposition.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot suffer a fracture and these bones are elevated above their natural position, then the patient should rest his foot on prepared ground as described.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And then place something on top of that which is raised from those bones, and press down on them, and bind them so that they return to their places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And then apply a plaster above it and place something above that, and below the chest of the patient place a small table with two flat surfaces.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And then strengthen that limb with a proper structure, since you have wrapped it in cloths and other materials as needed.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And as three or four days pass, then you loosen the bandage, for you will find the bones bound, either joined together or dislocated, and the treatment in such cases is as you know.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if some say they are joined together, then you should restore them and bind them as I recommend to you in the restoration of the fingers of the hand.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	And then place a splint under the joined finger according to the length of the finger, and leave some space around it; and below the patient place the table as recommended to you, and strengthen it with proper support.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if what is joined together involves two or three or more bones, then you should place a splint of appropriate size wrapped in linen cloth on each finger, and strengthen the table at the base of the patient’s body so that it rests on one of the flat surfaces of the table for proper support across the chest.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is important for you not to forget that you should consider all the causes mentioned to you in the treatment of other fractures and accidents that we have discussed; and prepare yourself for every condition with what is necessary.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter Eighteen.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	On the fracture of the skull of a woman and of the bone of the penis and of the virile member of a man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the skull of a woman is fractured, at that time make that incision in the area where it has occurred, and then slightly incline it towards the part of the back.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And then the midwife should fill the skull with cotton, and it should be done in such a way that it conforms to the shape of the head; and then the woman should be bandaged, and her back slightly elevated little by little, because all this is done so that before the fracture site, it remains as it was and the fractured bone returns to its place.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And then place poultices on her back, and when she wants to urinate, remove the cotton to facilitate it, and after she urinates, reduce and return that as per the method by which you mixed it at the beginning, and then return to her initial poultice.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do this for seven days or around that time, because it takes that long to restore.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take a sheep's bladder and sew onto it a tube made of cane; then insert the entire bladder into the skull fracture site, and then blow air through the tube until the bladder is inflated inside the head, because this helps the fracture to return to its proper position.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then fill it with cotton and keep it for several days as we have recommended, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the penis in a man or woman is fractured, at that time administer for its restoration and alignment what we have recommended for the hip bone.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	In what is true and not hidden in these nearby fractures that rarely occur, especially for one who has some study and use and understands my book; for that fracture signifies to you in the major dispositions by the true method in the restoration and in the tightening of it, and thus understands well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	In the penis of the man when it is grasped, take a bandage made of cloth, and put the penis in that; then place around it a wrapping of cloth, and let it be wrapped up, and afterwards let it be left for three days or about that time, and it will be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of bone fractures when they are inflamed.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is appropriate for one to whom it happens that there is a fracture with inflammation, and especially if the bone is large like the bone of the thigh or the humerus, or similar to those, that you treat and bleed them immediately if the conditions for bleeding indicate this as we have said above.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the inflammation causes bleeding, now it is appropriate that you treat for retention of it by such means as you powder on it finely powdered eggshell, if no other cause is present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And then begin to restore the fracture on that same day, and do not delay this, unless an abscess occurs.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if an abscess forms suddenly, now you should delay the restoration of it until the ninth day, until the abscess has subsided, and do not approach it on the third and fourth days thereafter, for you will cause harmful accidents.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	If a broken bone protrudes above the joint and is visible, you should proceed to reduce it and align it with ease and minimal extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	If extension is not within your capability and the alignment requires more than what you have, then you should reduce it with these tools; and this tool is made of iron, its length being seven or eight digits, and its width according to the size of the wound; and therefore it is necessary for the surgeon to take three or four such tools, depending on what is needed for various types of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be round, and slightly thickened so that it does not bend due to the pressure on it during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And it should have a sharp tip at which there is a margin on both ends; and the upper part should be thicker, while the middle part should taper towards the sides.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the form of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is called in Greek "labrum volentz atelarem," which means a small palette.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	So that the end of it can be placed steadily with the tip raised above the protruding end of the bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And press it in one motion until the bone returns to its place and is aligned with some degree of alignment.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And thus strive to align the ends of the fracture between them, and if the broken end is delicate and does not hold the tool well, then you should insert the end of that bone so that the instrument has a good grip on it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	If you cannot reduce the bone with what we have recommended, then now use that with what is suitable for the knives which we have mentioned; or saw that with one of the saws in whatever way is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And remove that which remains in the bone of roughness and small scratches.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and after the reduction the patient still suffers from severe pain in the tooth, then you will know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and then do what you consider will be of great benefit to the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration of the bone is complete, then soak a cloth in black styptic wine, and do this properly even in summer, and do not place cerot or any other substance containing oil on the wound, so that it does not cause rotting and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer poultices at the appropriate time for your completion of the bone's restoration, and leave the wound uncovered so that you can cut away any protruding parts with forceps and use dressings according to the extent of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be careful not to touch the wound at the fracture, for many times unskilled doctors have done this, and it has caused death or incurable illness or severe harm to their patients.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the swelling is slight, soft, and different from the swelling of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the wound is large or it is a bad wound, and you fear some of the accidents we have mentioned, and you feel pain in that area, then do not use poultices on it, but instead apply a dressing made of hard cloths rather than poultices and treat it accordingly.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when one or two days have passed since the wound began to heal, whereupon granulation has started to form, then you remove the cloth that you had placed over it, and immediately apply bandages, using those which according to our custom are used for treating wounds, such as tetradecphas and similar ones to this.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is necessary for you to untie the bandage and examine the wound every morning and evening until it is consolidated and healed, and it should be such that the member is prepared in such a way that the pus can drain from it downwards with ease.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If several days have passed since the wound began and it has not consolidated nor has the granulation tissue formed, then you should know that here there is a delay due to small issues, for which you must examine the wound with a probe.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those delays, those that are separate should be removed and extracted, while those that cannot be separated and cause pain when the member is moved, you should proceed to incise them according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if the wound becomes infected with gangrene or erysipelas, or any other type of corruption and putrefaction, then you should proceed according to one of those methods mentioned in the preceding chapter on the treatment of such conditions.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And regarding this matter in which you must be cautious and present your best judgment: when a large bone is broken, treat the limb as you would the bones of the wrist and forearm and similar ones, and do not attempt traction or extraction if doing so might lead to death after four attempts; leave it inside for pus to drain, as it will likely fall out on its own within twenty or thirty days; and then attend to the wound if it is visible, otherwise leave it be.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the treatment of joint stiffness that occurs as a consequence of some fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	This stiffness often occurs in the joints during the healing of a fracture, especially near the joints themselves, and it distorts the shape of the limb; and it greatly prevents the limb from performing its natural functions.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider whether the stiffness is recent and administer medicines that have a binding effect such as aloes, henbane, wormwood, squill, colocynth, and similar ones; take any of these individually or in combination. Confess (administer) them either by mouth with vinegar, or with egg white, or mixed with water, and apply it to the stiffness on linen, and bind it tightly with proper compression.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And let the compression remain for several days without loosening it; then loosen it and reapply another one until the stiffness is alleviated; or apply a thin sheet of lead over it gradually, as lead has the property of reducing inflammation in limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if the stiffness has already turned to bone and is causing severe pain, necessitating its removal urgently, then cut it at the part that is most affected, and excise the excess or reduce it with some instruments until it is alleviated; and care for it until it heals.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of a fracture when it is set and subsequently the limb becomes weak and does not follow its natural course.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture is set, and subsequently the limb becomes weak and frail, this happens for several reasons: one reason is excessive dissolution of bandages and binding done improperly; or due to overly tight compression preventing nourishment from reaching the limb; or due to an excess of unnecessary applications; or due to premature movement not at the appropriate time; or due to a lack of blood in the patient's body and weakness.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	For the treatment, give food to the patient and make his heart tender so that the blood multiplies in him; administer baths; and apply cautery and cupping to him.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And apply plasters to the limb, so that the plaster attracts nourishment; or continue rubbing with cold water, until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural form.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the treatment of broken bones when they have healed incorrectly and prohibit further operation on them.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When it happens that a limb already restored near its healing shows curvature and prominence in the broken bone and knotting, and this is due to the deformation of the shape of the limb; however, since the limb is not prohibited from its natural movement, you should not accept the word of one who believes that member to be newly broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But there are indeed false physicians and restorers who have done this in our land; and this operation is a reprehensible one, leading to great fear, the sign of which is fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	But if the limping and knotting are recent, then it is necessary to rub them with cold water in which soft herbs are soaked, such as flax seeds and radish roots, and melilot, and similar ones; and a soft plaster should be applied as well, made properly for this purpose; or take mucilage from radish seeds and mix it with flour of linseed or olive oil, then apply it; or grind fat figs with dove’s milk, and similar medicines to those mentioned for consolidating.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	In some cases, it is dissolved by constant gentle friction which is applied to the most humid parts, and movement of the member should be administered to all parts at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the tortuosity has already advanced and has become hard and converted into stone, and it has caused the need for treatment with iron, then it is necessary to let the pus above drain out and the continuation of the bone be dissolved, and to excise what is superfluous from the knotting of that material with the bone with subtle instruments, and facilitate this under careful attention and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De sermo en dislocacio.	On the treatment of dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of any of the joints from its proper place, by which it is prohibited from movement, and the figure of the member is distorted, causing severe pain and great injuries.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	When a dislocation occurs, it is necessary to attempt its reduction as soon as possible and not delay in reducing it, for if it is delayed, the joint becomes inflamed and hard, making the reduction of the dislocation difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason, it is not advisable to move or extend the limb during the period of inflammation, as movement often causes spasm and severe pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	But when this happens, it is necessary to prepare for the puncture of the abscess, and allow the limb to rest until the inflammation subsides; then bathe the member with warm water and oil, and subsequently reduce it with care.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And treat the entire limb with what will help it remember its proper place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	Here are the bones set in order as previously described for fractures; I now enter into the part dealing with lesser wounds.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIIIV.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the lower jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So when both jaws are dislocated and do not function; the dislocation of both can be done in one of two ways: either they are partially removed from their positions with slight movement, and slightly softened; or they are completely dislocated and fully displaced, to the point where they are softened at the joint where saliva flows, and where he cannot hold anything nor close his mouth, and his tongue is wrapped around his words.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	But when the dislocation is slight, it often returns to its proper position on its own with little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	But if the dislocation is complete and full, it must be reduced immediately, and should not be delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the minister hold the head of the patient, and the physician insert his thumb into the root of the dislocated jaw inside the mouth if the dislocation is on one side; or he inserts both thumbs together if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers should be outside equally; and orders the patient to cease moving their jaws and relax them on each side; and the physician then guides the jaw back into place until it returns to its proper position.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, especially if both jaws are dislocated together, then administer a warm mixture of water and oil to ease the reduction of both, and do not delay the reduction of both at all, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so when returning and using bandages, and the mouth of the wound is closed and not softened, at that time pause on those powders of cloth with wax, and let it be made of wax and rubbed oil; and then let it be applied with ease to the soft parts.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his back, and his head be placed between his two ears, so that it does not turn to the right or left; and do not force him to chew for any reason; let his food be given in liquid form until such time as when the pains have subsided and his jaws are loosened, then allow him to eat what he wishes.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be administered with ease, and do not work on the opening of the mouth for eating and drinking and other uses until such time as the jaw is loosened and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of both jaws when they are dislocated at any time and not returned to their places is difficult, then fevers often occur with frequent sweat, and easily the patient's belly becomes swollen, and easily vomiting of pure bile occurs.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then you know that it is hopeless; and often the one to whom this happens dies within ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the clavicle and the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The clavicle is not dislocated from the chest inward towards the body; and sometimes it is dislocated outward, and this can be felt.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And for the restoration of the hand, the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	And then press the area with your palm firmly, for it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	And then apply the plaster and powder to that area.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	But the extremity of that which joins the spine and is continuous with it does not become dislocated in any day; therefore, it must be reduced and bandaged as we have said and according to how you have prepared it.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the plaster, powder, and bandage, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until he is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And in this method of treatment, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the Reduction of Muscle Dislocation.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is when it is dislocated from the upper part to the lower part.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is when it is dislocated at the upper part of the muscle, and this happens slowly; and it does not become dislocated at the rear parts by the shoulder; and it does not become dislocated at the front parts by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And it is most often dislocated and protruded at the lower parts below the joint, and more particularly in those whose flesh is thin, it easily becomes dislocated; but in those with thick muscles, it protrudes with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	If it happens that any person is struck or falls and the muscle of the place becomes swollen with swelling, and it is treated with what has already been displaced.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then proceed with that which you have placed upon it, and now proceed with the treatment of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is known when it is in the lower parts away from the tendon; therefore, distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the normal muscle, for you will notice clear differences among them; you will find a concavity at the head of the muscle and below the tendon there is contact with the head of the muscle as if by someone, and the injured person cannot move their hand to their ear, nor can they use that limb in any movement.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the feet or above, then you will immediately notice a clear touch, and it is not concealed.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And this dislocation is gently reduced when it is fresh and the injured person is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the practitioner raises the hand of the injured above the parts; then he places his fingers below the tendon and elevates the joint with strength to its proper place, and the practitioner raises the hand of the injured, and extends it properly; then he holds it still as it returns gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return as we have said and after several days from the beginning of the dislocation, then the injured person should be bathed in hot water and administered a lotion to soften and smooth it as if for burns, using fenugreek, melilot in water, and it should be applied.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Let the patient lie supine on their back and place under them a pillow of wool that is even between softness and firmness. Then the surgeon places his hand on the sphere and lifts the muscle upward, and holds the patient's arm so it is not injured in the process, and another assistant should hold the patient’s head so it is not turned to either side, for it immediately returns to its position.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce that second in this manner: have present a man who is taller than the patient and station him on the side of that flank. Insert your hand under the patient’s muscle below the swelling and lift the swelling up toward the head so the patient is suspended in air, and another assistant should hold the patient's arm from behind their abdomen.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, then it is necessary to have something else by which they can be suspended, so that the weight will hold them firmly, for the dislocation returns immediately otherwise.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in this other manner: drive a long pole into the ground with its top rounded like a pestle’s head, neither too thick nor too thin. Place the patient below and have them stand along the length of the pole. Then extend one arm to the side opposite the pole, and firmly extend the rest of their body; the joint will quickly return to its place.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if the reduction of it is difficult due to all the causes we have mentioned, then use this treatment: take a pole whose length is two yards, width four fingers, and thickness gradually tapering according to the form of the swelling as follows:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And upon the head place linen cloths so that the flesh does not injure the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And let the navel of the patient be pressed down, and let the hand or arm be extended over the body inside the parts below, and let the body be bandaged around the helpers and the arm and the extremity of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	And let the arm be placed on a ladder according to the latitude, and the hand be extended below the parts, and the other side be suspended from the other side, because the joint will soon follow.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument is complete according to each manner that is possible for you, then it is necessary that you place below the navel a pad of wool of equal quantity; and afterward place a plaster prepared with powder of burnt eggshells and albumen of eggs over all the muscle, as mentioned above, and then strengthen below the navel with appropriate bandaging; and the bandage should be wrapped around the plaster, and the hand should be attached to the neck, and left alone, and do not disturb the hand for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it is necessary that the patient's food be small until the member is strengthened, for it is easier for their recovery.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then food should be given more after seven or five days, and exercise one movement; and thus if it is firm and not softened, now it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated due to swelling that occurs or for some other reason, then it is necessary to administer cautery with three tractions as mentioned earlier in the chapter on cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and after about seven days the bandage is removed and the joint has not healed, and the plaster and strapping are reduced over several applications, and it cannot be fixed, and he cannot raise that arm to the upper parts, then you know that the nerves of it, which run to the head of the muscle, have either been cut or stretched or weakened, and understand that the joint will never heal in its proper place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Regarding the dislocation that occurs from the feet and the hip or the posterior parts, the reduction is performed with impulse and extension as much as necessary until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And let the other strapping be applied to it, and care for it until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if heaviness and slowness in the movement occur near recovery, then the patient should use baths several times until that heaviness is alleviated and it returns to its original nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of dislocation of the neck.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the joint of the neck is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it can be dislocated in all directions, but mostly toward the front or back. And this dislocation does not hide from you when it lies beneath the skin or by touch according to its figure, and when you adjust the dislocated neck, that is made clear to you, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm nor reach the muscle's usual place.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And it is necessary that you treat the neck, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before it becomes inflamed, because if it becomes inflamed, reduction will be difficult, and even after a long time it may not heal completely. And especially when it is in the posterior parts, for it is worse than all other types of dislocations, more painful, and often leads to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it is such that if it is possible to reduce it, then the hand should be extended beyond the two fingers, and the arm should be expanded, and the physician's hands should be above the joint below it, and he should push the joint with his fingertips or with the palm of his hand until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is to the front parts, then it returns thus: bend the hand with its fingers, so that he strikes the joint with the palm of his hand.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey reduction, then administer vigorous extension and strong movement.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers should extend the arm, and they should hold it thus with two ministers so that it is not bent due to the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And it should be rotated the arm in all directions, since it is wrapped in folded cloth long over the hand, or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, anoint it with some oil so that this helps in the lubricity of the joint for ease; and then push the joint with strong pressure until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And after the reduction, it is necessary for the patient to rest on a plaster bandage that has stipticity and support with an eagle's claw position, and be wrapped tightly, and the arm should be suspended from the neck, and left like this for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be loosened; and if the joint is formed in its place, then you loosen the bandage of it and leave it like that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint should not be stitched, then apply the plaster and bandage again, and leave it like that for several days until it is healed; and afterwards remove it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	And if it happens that there is great pain during the reduction of the joint and its position is in motion, then administer humidification through bathing and gentle friction, and compression until it is calmed; or place upon the joint something immobile, which is called an immobile support; and afterwards bind it, and leave it on the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And afterwards remove that, and place it in a bath; and when it is dry, then you should rub the joint with moderate friction, and afterwards apply an immobile support again, which is called a hard bandage, once, and the second time, and the third time,
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	in the bathing instrument until it is finished.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, place a humid and heated cow's hide on that wound and stitch it; and do this for several times, as it is moist and helps to restore its position.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of the wrist joint, which is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The wrist joint sometimes becomes dislocated, and the reduction of this dislocation is easy, but the opposite is true for other joints. Nevertheless, it is necessary to act with speed in reducing it at the moment when it is dislocated, before swelling occurs or an abscess forms.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	Here is the translation:
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it must be considered whether the palm is already stretched over the belly of the hand. If the injury has occurred, then place the back of the patient's hand on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation was before placing both hands down, then position the hand intrinsically on the table so that the doctor's hand can act directly upon that proximity of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if it returns immediately, that is good; but otherwise, then strengthen that area with a bandage covering the abscess and leave it like that; and do not repeat this action, for otherwise, it will neither suffer nor allow the reduction of the pus over the days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint moves according to its tortuousness; and if you notice in the patient no cause for pain, except that the hand is softened and cannot bear any weight; then know that the nerves are either crushed or severed, and at this point do not apply anything but cauterize it properly, and strengthen it so as not to cause further injury.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	And when it has been properly returned, then place on the bandage which we have recommended, and let it be left and strengthened for five days; and afterward, it should be loosened and left, with the hand of the patient being exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	However, if the movement of the hand is restricted and you encounter any severity in it, then apply that area with warm water and friction several times until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the Treatment of the Dislocation of the Said Joints.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Several times the said joints may become completely dislocated.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	When a finger is dislocated at the joint nearest the palm or at the middle joint, hold the finger still and gently push the dislocation back into place.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then hold the tip of the finger, and suspend it above the part that is dislocated, and leave it like this for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it until it is properly bandaged on that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, wrap it as described, and do not stop unwrapping it during the day to exercise its movement, and wrap it at night; and do this for several days until it is strong.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same if it is dislocated at the wrist, and wrap it in this manner and perform the first operation like this until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And do the same when it is dislocated at other parts as well.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the vertebrae in the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a complete dislocation occurs in one of the vertebrae of the back or neck and the vertebrae are moved from their positions, then there is no treatment for this, as death is feared for the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	The sign of this is that the patient's defecation occurs without their will, and they cannot control it; often, some parts of their body become weak or two limbs on one side or both arms, or one of these; or a vertebra is displaced from its position, as sometimes it shifts and sometimes it moves to four different directions.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Thus it is described for the parts behind and is called jellyfish-like.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	The treatment for it is that you consider whether the condition occurred due to labor, for if it did, there is no cure then, nor will it heal completely from that.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in the case where it comes from a fall or a blow or something similar to these, the Ancients described the methods of treatment at great length, much of which I cannot recall; but I have abbreviated what little can excuse the abundance, due to my closeness to understanding and exposition, with which I have laid out and formed this from various instruments different from those with which I would show this and explain that.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And he says that in the condition occurring at the front part of the feet, there is neither remedy nor healing for it; and similarly for those made on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And only those are cured which occur exactly as I describe on both sides.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient lies on his face near a wall, and lies below the bed in such a way that his feet are not touching the ground.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And nearby a straight post should be placed, planted in the ground at the end near his head, and another post around his feet at the other end of the bed.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister should hold the post, and it should not be fixed in a hole; and another minister should hold the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And nearby wrap around the head of the patient and below the shoulders tie a strong bandage; and extend the end of the bandage to the post that is behind his head, and tie it there; and then stretch the other bandage over the hips of the patient with the hands behind the buttocks; and then adjust all the bandages and tie them to the other post that is behind his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	Then let the attendant extend the bandages at the part of the body, and do not remove the two limbs and the bandages from their places where they are placed, but rather do not secure them so firmly as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	Then the physician should place his palms on the strong part of the spine until it returns, or he should place it on that table, and then adjust the patient's weight on the table until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return by this method, now take a table whose width or length is about three arms, and dig into the wall near the patient a place where the end of the table can fit.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	Then place the middle of the table on the spine, and the physician should place his weight on the other end, and pull gently until the spine is compressed and returns to its proper place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open the ring which is revolved around the hand; and it is that you place the patient on the ground with the head of the patient at the end of two poles, the length of which is one arm, and from the head of the patient to the other end, two similar poles; and the distance between each pole should be a palm, and they are fixed in the ground so that they do not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there should be one round pole in which is the ring, and it should revolve around the two ends of the two poles.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a knob in which the pole is formed, the length of which is one palm where it is revolved; and on the two other poles there is something similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Unbind the bandages that you have tightly bound to the patient’s feet at the time when you were about to cut his head, and the bandages that you have tightly bound around his thighs at the time when you were about to cut his legs.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	You should have each turn held by a minister with his hand, and the surgeon should hold the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And after the spine is returned and the place is adjusted, now you should apply an excipient poultice on white cloth, and then add wool; and then place over the poultice strips of wood whose width is three fingers or around that size, and whose length should cover the area affected by inflammation, and along the part of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then bind it with the bandage as we have described, and let the patient use delicate nourishment until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any inflammation remains in the area at the end of the healing process, now you should administer medicines that soften and soothe through prolonged application, as we have recommended; and a sheet of lead is also applied to that location.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And at times inflammation occurs in the back of the lower spine due to displacement; and that bone is one where it is not advisable to apply this medicine, as it could easily lead to fatal consequences.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the bone and the joint of the muscle are subject only to dislocation, and do not suffer what happens to other joints with slight movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the bone is dislocated in four ways, for it can be dislocated inwardly, outwardly, forward, or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is most commonly dislocated inwardly, and rarely forward or backward.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation inward is that when you adjust the leg of the healthy side against the affected side, it is longer and the heel is more prominent than on the healthy side, and the patient cannot bend their knee towards their chest, and this location where bending occurs is often inflamed or swollen due to cautery, so the head of the bone has already reached here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of one to whom dislocation occurs outwardly is that the symptoms of it are contrary to those mentioned earlier.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of one to whom dislocation occurs forward is that when lifting the leg according to its full range, it does not bend due to pain in the heel, and if they attempt to walk, they cannot step forward; and their urine is retained and their swallowing is swollen, and they must walk on the sole of their foot.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of one to whom dislocation occurs backward is that they cannot extend their heel, nor can they bend it forward as much as the other leg, and their leg is shorter than the other, and their throat is swollen, and the head of the bone is in that location.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The final reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you consider, at this time, if the dislocation is old and ancient, which already has been suffered by its owner for some time, you administer reduction to it and treat it according to its disposition; now it is not in that complete cure; and then there must be no expectation of full recovery.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In the case where the dislocation is recent and belongs to one of the four species of dislocation, now you must attend to this by returning the joint and extending it in both directions within and without, and move it to the right and left, for it easily returns and does not require any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	However, if it does not return in this manner, now you must prepare a strong assistant and extend the side of the limb from below, or along its sides, or use a bandage that is wrapped above the joint; and another assistant should extend the hand over there so as to place their hands on either side of the joint; then apply a lion's bandage tightly around the joint, and have another assistant hold the end of the bandage.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And this extension of the limb or of the part inside towards the clavicle, or of the part behind towards the back.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And perform the extension of all these in one motion while the patient is raised off the ground and remains hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four types.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns as we have said, it is good; and if not, now it is necessary for all species what I will say about its proper treatment.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of the shoulder when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is towards the inner parts, it must be that the patient lies supine on his back; and then place the bandages along the ridge of the shoulder in the place where between the head of the shoulder and the place below the collarbone; and then extend the bandage from the angle as far as the outermost part of the clavicle.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong assistant should take hold of his arms and firmly grasp the thick part of the dislocated shoulder and extend it outward with great force, for that returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this particular type is the easiest to cure among those in which this member is reduced compared to the other types.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it slips away from you and does not obey in the exercise for this type of treatment at all, then bandages must be placed on both sides of the patient's body with a strong, light bandage over both heels and both toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each be four fingers, and let the affected side be extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.
